content: 3 double_crochet in next 3 double_crochet 2 double_crochet in next double_crochet double_crochet in next 4 double_crochet 2 double_crochet in next double_crochet around join with slip_stitch in top of chain 3 36 double_crochet made round 7 - chain 1 does not count as first single_crochet single_crochet in same st single_crochet in each st around join with slip_stitch in top of first single_crochet 36 single_crochet made fasten_off round 8 - join mc with slip_stitch to first single_crochet of previous round slip_stitch in each st around join with slip_stitch in first slip_stitch 36 slip_stitch made fasten_off fold the last few row toward the outside to make the brim once you start folding it will kind of naturally fall into place it should lay so that the crown of the hat is only mc and the brim is only cc click on photo for frighteningly large view that should illustrate this nicely if scarily you may have to lean back a little using a yarn needle thread the tail from beginning chain through the hole formed by the first round to the right side thread the tail back through the same hole to the back side leaving a loop tie the yarn to the back side and weave in end weave in all other ends now your lids won t have to run around nekkid whew
